title: Create compliance reports for products using user-based license rules
content:
This section describes how to create compliance reports for products that use user-based license rules, such as Adobe products. To ensure the data accuracy of compliance reports, SAM requires that you synchronize the device data between Service Management and UD/UCMDB. With the entitlement information well managed, you can then track and compare license entitlements and consumption.

Take Adobe as an example. To create SAM compliance reports, follow these steps:

  1. Run required discovery jobs to prepare UD/UCMDB data.
  2. Synchronize the product family.
  3. Maintain license compatibility matrix based on the publisher's official documentation. 
  4. Configure license rules.
    Currently, the Generic user-based license rule is available for user-based products. See Supported software titles.
    For Adobe products, you can also use the Adobe user-based licensing license rule.
  5. Configure license models to build the license pool. See the Software coverage section.
    • If your license provides you with the right to use an individual application, select the latest product version that this license can cover. 
    • If your license can cover Adobe's full suite of applications, add more product versions as needed. Make sure you select the latest version for each product. In this case, all products share the same license point during license consumption.
  6. Configure entitlement information:
    1. Entitle users to use the license:
      1. Go to the Licenses page and select the required license record.
      2. On the General tab page, go to the User list section.
      3. Click Add or the grid icon , select the users as needed, and then click Save.
        The added users are entitled to use the license. By default, one user can consume one license.
    2. Assign an owner to the device:
      1. From the main menu, select Build > Service Asset & Configuration.
      2. From SACM Home, select Devices, and then select the desired device record.
      3. On the General tab page, go to the Overview section, and make sure the device owner is specified.
      4. Save the changes.
  7. Calculate license consumption.
  8. View compliance status.
    If the user name is <N/A>, this value is the total number of license consumption on all devices that have no device owner assigned. You can go to Service Asset & Configuration to add the device owner information. For details, see Step 6 (b).
  9. Analyze compliance report.
